Prompt.Value: Fill out this screen only if you are using VeriSign CyberCash. If you are not going to use the CyberCash verification/clearing system, please leave these fields blank and click "Continue."
Please choose the database system and database access method that will be used for this FishCart. Typically native methods are used on Unix servers, and ODBC on NT servers.

SAVING YOUR INFORMATION: you may want to save this information for easy re-use. Click the above button to either save changes to the open profile or to save it to a file of your choosing. It is recommended to save the profile outside the Installer file tree for ease of access from later versions of the Installer.
This final step sets up the database tables and loads a few initial values into your installed FishCart. If you are updating a FishCart and do not want to overwrite the tables you may already have set up, click "Cancel". Otherwise click "Continue" to proceed. NOTE: your FishCart SQL user must have create table privileges for this final step to successfully complete.
When this step is complete, you should be able to access your FishCart at the URL you entered previously. If there are problems, carefully review the information you entered for typing errors. If it is correct, review the FAQ for information that may apply to your situation. You can also ask for help on the FishCart support list; see http://fishcart.org/subscribe.html for more information.
When the cart is responding with the opening page, you can go to the installed URL plus "/maint" to add subzone and shipping profiles, categories, and products. Be sure and password protect the "/maint" directory.
Thank you again for your interest in FishCart!
Please fill out all available information about your database.
Enter your database user name and password below.
Web and database servers are on the same computer.
If the database server is on a different physical computer, enter the address FishCart will use to access it. (ex.- tcpip somehost.somedomain.tld 1313)
FishCart Administration: for use with the maintenance pages to access non-public tables.
FishCart Split Credit Card: for use with split credit card tables.
FishCart Public Side: for use with the public pages of FishCart to retrieve and view table information.
Since you have root access to the database, this will define the users to be created for use with this FishCart installation.
Please type in the full directory path to the directory that contains your web site (i.e.- '/home/www/acme'). If you do not know this information, leave this field blank.

FishCart is typically installed in a directory under your website (example: 'http://www.acme.com/store'). Please select a name for this directory below, such as "/store" or "/catalog", or leave it blank to install into the top level directory. If the subdirectory does not exist it will be created for you.
If the full directory path for the secure installation is different, please type it in below. If you do not know this information leave it blank.
Enter this information only if you are installing FishCart onto a Windows NT server. On NT, FishCart accesses the database via ODBC. Otherwise, leave this page blank.

If the Web files are in a directory under the FTP login directory, enter the appropriate names in "Web Directory" (example: "/public_html") and the "Secure Directory" fields (example: "/secure_html"). If your hosting environment does not use these, leave them blank.
Please use '/', not '\', in all directory paths regardless of server type.
It is normal for the Installer not to respond during the FTP upload process; please be patient, as this process may take up to several minutes to complete depending on the speed of your Internet connection.
Please enter the path to the background graphic (if known) relative to the document root directory specified earlier (ex.- '/images/background.png').
Full Company Name (including HTML tags, if needed)

This information will help determine the appearance of the cart. If you do not know the address for the masthead and background graphics, leave them blank. This information can be changed after installation in the FishCart administration area.
Please enter the path to the masthead graphic (if known) relative to the document root directory specified earlier (ex.- '/images/masthead.png').

If you are running the Installer on the same physical computer on which you are installing FishCart, you can complete the installation by choosing "localhost". Otherwise, choose "FTP" to proceed to fill out the FTP login information for your site.

Prompt.Tip: Force return to main FishCart installation screen (N.B. will abandon current position)
Open a previously saved FishCart profile

Prompt.Value:
Welcome to the FishCart Installer! This program will help you install FishCart quickly and efficiently by FTP onto your Web site. To install the FishCart version included with this Installer, click the Install FishCart button.
To install FishCart from a different source tree, select File / Find Source Tree, then browse to the FishCart source directory (usually called "fishcart_v3").
You may want to review the information needed to install FishCart under Documents / CHECKLIST. If you do not know it, you will need to obtain the information from your system administrator or hosting provider.
If you have previously installed FishCart and saved the profile, you can open it now from File / Open Profile. Then click the 'Install FishCart' button. You will need to scroll to the bottom of some screens to accept the terms and proceed.
This is the community supported version of the Installer. Support is available from the FishCart mailing list, 'fishcart@fishcart.org'. You can subscribe to the list from the FishCart open source web site at http://fishcart.org/subscribe.html. You must be subscribed to send to the list.
FishNet also offers fee based installation, support, and custom development for the Installer to help you meet your particular needs. For more information please see http://www.fishnetinc.com/install_support.html.
The Installer periodically retrieves sponsor banners from an Internet server. No information you enter is revealed to the banner server. Because we respect your privacy, the Installer makes available only the information you voluntarily and optionally enter on the Registration page.
Thank you again for your interest in FishCart, and happy installing!

Prompt.Tip: Browse your local filesystem for a Fishcart source tree
Additional FishCart modules to be installed

Prompt.Value: If the database server is on a different physical computer, enter the address FishCart will use to access it. (ex.- dbhost.acme.com)
If you will be using Associate ID information to identify the source of an access to FishCart, please enter a default Associate ID now.
Enter a confirmation email address to be sent in the "From:" field of the confirmation email sent to a customer after ordering.
Please choose email addresses for the order form information to be sent to. To help insure that orders are not lost, more than one address is recommended, on different servers if possible.
A PGP Key ID can be used for encrypting email with order information. DO NOT fill this field in if you are using the split credit card system (recommended) or unencrypted email (not recommended).

The information you have provided will now be integrated into the FishCart files in preparation for uploading to your server. This may take a few moments. It is normal during this time that the Installer will not respond.
If this is a re-installation and you have modified the CSS style sheet and/or the language prompt files, check the box below to keep your changes.
Do not overwrite style sheet and language files.

Either click Check All or check just the pages you want to apply the template to, then select your own template with Add Template, then click Apply Templates. Refer to TEMPLATE_FAQ for detailed template instructions.
Would you like to use a pre-built template from the FishCart distribution or have you made your own custom template?
To preview a template, choose "Preview." When you have made your decision, choose "Apply Template."

FishCart can be installed into a Web page template included with the Installer, or into a Web page template of your own design. This is an excellent way to quickly enhance the look and feel of your installed FishCart. For more information see Documentation / TEMPLATE_FAQ.
Please select the appropriate button.
Enter your domain name (example: acme.com or acme.co.uk). Enter only the second level domain (acme) and the top level domain (.com, .net, .co.uk, etc.) Do not enter components such as "www".

Choose a FishCart ID for this installation. Each FishCart installation on a server must have a unique ID to identify it. Please choose a unique and descriptive ID of no more than 20 numbers or letters only (examples: "fc", "store3").

Please enter the complete URL for the site where secure portions of the FishCart catalog will be kept. This may be the same as your non-secure URL, or it might be something like http://secure.acme.com/~username or http://secure.acme.com:444/~username.
Please enter the complete URL for the non-secure website where this FishCart will be installed. (example: http://www.acme.com)
This will install the necessary tools for exporting into QuickBooks environments

The QuickBooks tools will be installed with this FishCart installation. Please install FishCart now. After installation, you may access the tools from the "qb" directory under the maintenance directory.
The QuickBooks tools has now be installed. Please type in the website address and the SQL tables will be set up.
If you have already installed FishCart and would like to add QuickBooks Exporting, please click below to upload the QuickBooks Export Feature over FTP.
If you are about to install FishCart, please click below and the QuickBooks files will be installed with the rest of FishCart.
Please enter the complete directory information that is required to access the JSP applications on the JSP server. If you are connecting to FishNet, this will be 'apps'.
Please enter the username and password if they are needed for connecting to your JSP server. If you are connecting to FishNet for JSP hosting, this should have been provided to you on purchase.
Please enter the complete URL for the site where JSP applications will be kept. If you are connecting to FishNet for JSP hosting, the address will be upsgate.fishnet.us.
